intro: Appunia longiloba, commonly known as the long-stemmed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are elongated and somewhat woody. Appunia longiloba is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
